Description: Limestone statue of a Nubian prisoner, kneeling with his arms bound behind his back, reconstructed from several fragments with a considerable quantity of restoration. All the left side of the head and face, with much of the back, has been restored in plaster. The figure rests on a roughly worked low plinth, integral with the statue. It has been joined through the waist and the legs. The captive wears a short wig and beard, the nose is broken, the eyes incised.
